laboratory_examinations.findings: Several abnormal results that closely reproduced her clinical symptoms, attenuated muscle sympathetic nerve activity in response to tilt testing, and elevated plasma catecholamine concentrations.
Incidental mitral valve prolapse and normal left ventricular systolic function.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Maintained between 12–15 mmHg during and after surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Heart rate and mean arterial pressure ranging from 65 to 130 beats/min and from 55 to 120 mmHg respectively.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Heart rate and mean arterial pressure controlled between 86–98 beats/min and 75–90 mmHg during the remainder of the case.
